text: Better by far you should forget and smile, than that you should remember and be sad.
author: Christina Rossetti

text: Can I see another's woe, and not be in sorrow too? Can I see another's grief, and not seek for kind relief?
author: William Blake

text: Do not stand at my grave and cry; I am not there. I did not die.
author: Mary Elizabeth Frye

text: Don't hate the player, hate the game.
author: Ice T

text: Even as the stone of the fruit must break, that its heart may stand in the sun, so must you know pain.
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: I feel your pain. The pain in knowing this has happened to you. The pain in knowing what more tears we have gained. But through all this, I feel your pain.
author: Octavia B. Hawkins-Richardson

text: If you try to please audiences, uncritically accepting their tastes, it can only mean that you have no respect for them.
author: Andrei Tarkovsky

text: I feel within me a peace above all earthly dignities, a still and quiet conscience.
author: William Shakespeare

text: In the end, we only regret the chances we didn't take.
author: Lewis Carroll

text: I stand amid the roar of a surf-tormented shore, and I hold within my hand grains of the golden sand. How few! Yet how they creep through my fingers to the deep.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

text: Laugh, and the world laughs with you. Weep, and you weep alone.
author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

text: Life is a mosaic of pleasure and pain. Grief is an interval between two moments of joy. You have no rose without a thorn.
author: Sathya Sai Baba

text: Of all sad words of tongue or pen, the saddest are these: It might have been.
author: John Greenleaf Whittier

text: Oft expectation fails, and most oft there where most it promises.
author: William Shakespeare

text: Our doubts are traitors, and make us lose the good we oft might win, by fearing to attempt.
author: William Shakespeare

text: Pain has an element of blank. It cannot recollect when it began, or if there were a day when it was not.
author: Emily Dickinson

text: Patience is the foundation of eternal peace. Make anger your enemy. Find fault with yourself and not with others.
author: Tokugawa Ieyasu

text: She smiled in defeat, with unconquerable eyes.
author: Atticus

text: Something filled up my heart with nothing. Someone told me not to cry. Now that I'm older, my heart's colder, and I can see that it's a lie.
author: Arcade Fire

text: The pain I feel now is the happiness I had before. That's the deal.
author: C.S. Lewis

text: There are no regrets in life, just lessons.
author: Jennifer Aniston

text: The soul would have no rainbow, had the eyes no tears.
author: John Vance Cheney

text: This is the Hour of Lead. Remembered, if outlived, as freezing persons recollect the snow. First, chill. Then stupor. Then the letting go.
author: Emily Dickinson

text: This thing we call failure is not the falling down, but the staying down.
author: Mary Pickford

text: To live is to suffer. To survive is to find some meaning in the suffering.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: Whenever I climb, I am followed by a dog called Ego.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: You cannot now believe that you will ever feel better. But this is not true. You are sure to be happy again.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Your failure here is a metaphor. To learn for what, please resume climbing.
author: Rob Dubbin
